newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - May 5.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - May 5.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sri Lankan press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Tamil Tiger rebels launch artillery attack on Vavuniya military base and nearby villages.
Two-day strike by hospital workers disrupts work at 500 rural hospitals and dispensaries.
Police plan to triple strength of Special Task Force police commando unit by recruiting 6,000 constables to expand security operations in east.
Daewoo Corporation of Korea announces plans for massive investments in Sri Lanka, including automobile plant.
Sri Lanka has asked the United States to include Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE) rebels in its list of terrorist organisation and ban LTTE operations there, Justice Minister G.L. Peiris says.
